intro: Psychotria lophoclada, commonly known as the "Clove Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in rainforests. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though its use remains limited compared to other Psychotria species.
